Deprecated. 

Constructor

Parameters:
peerName - The PeerName to connect
bus - BusAttachment
serviceAvailabilityListener - Listener to receive session related events
objectPath - The name of the remote object
interfaceClass - The reflection of the AllJoyn BusObject interface that the remote object implements
port - port number to connect

ClientBaseImpl

public ClientBaseImpl(String peerName,
                      BusAttachment bus,
                      ServiceAvailabilityListener serviceAvailabilityListener,
                      String objectPath,
                      Class<?>[] interfaceClassArr,
                      short port)
Constructor

Parameters:
peerName - The PeerName to connect
bus - BusAttachment
serviceAvailabilityListener - Listener to receive session related events
objectPath - The name of the remote object
interfaceClassArr - The reflection of the AllJoyn BusObject interfaces that the remote object implements. The array is used in ProxyBusObject creation
port - port number to connect

getSessionId in interface ClientBase

AllJoyn session id
See Also:
ClientBase.getSessionId()

setSessionId

public void setSessionId(Integer sessionId)
The function provides the object with the sessionId of the previously established session
This is instead of calling the connect method to establish a new session.
Providing sessionId of NULL changes the internal object state to be disconnected, otherwise the state of the object is set to be connected.

Parameters:
sessionId - The session id to be set to the object

getObjectPath

public String getObjectPath()
Returns:
The name of the remote object

getObjectClass

@Deprecated
public Class<?> getObjectClass()
Deprecated. 

Returns:
The reflection of the AllJoyn BusObject interface that the remote object implements.
The Class object is retrieved from an internal interface class array.
To receive the whole array is better to use the getObjClassArr() method

getObjClassArr

public Class<?>[] getObjClassArr()
Returns:
Array of the AllJoyn BusObject interfaces classes that the remote object implements
